children.value: We’re almost ready to release React v0.9! We’re posting a release candidate so that you can test your apps on it; we’d much prefer to find show-stopping bugs now rather than after we release.
The release candidate is available for download from the CDN:
Please try these builds out and

In addition to the changes to React core listed below, we’ve made a small change to the way JSX interprets whitespace to make things more consistent. With this release, space between two components on the same line will be preserved, while a newline separating a text node from a tag will be eliminated in the output. Consider the code:

<div>
  Monkeys:
  {listOfMonkeys} {submitButton}
</div>
In v0.8 and below, it was transformed to the following:

React.DOM.div(null,
  " Monkeys: ",
  listOfMonkeys, submitButton
)
In v0.9, it will be transformed to this JS instead:

React.DOM.div(null,
  "Monkeys:",  listOfMonkeys, " ", submitButton)
We believe this new behavior is more helpful and eliminates cases where unwanted whitespace was previously added.
In cases where you want to preserve the space adjacent to a newline, you can write a JS string like
in your JSX source. We’ve included a script to do an automated codemod of your JSX source tree that preserves the old whitespace behavior by adding and removing spaces appropriately. You can
and run it over your source tree to modify files in place. The transformed JSX files will preserve your code’s existing whitespace behavior.
no longer receive the root node as a parameter; use
Whenever a prop is equal to
was previously deprecated and has now been removed
is now synchronous and returns the generated HTML string
tag using React) is now supported only when starting with server-rendered markup
When prop types validation fails, a warning is logged instead of an error thrown (with the production build of React, the type checks are now skipped for performance)
on components is now reserved for internal use by React
React now never rethrows errors, so stack traces are more accurate and Chrome’s purple break-on-error stop sign now works properly
Added a new tool for profiling React components and identifying places where defining
on component spec for static component methods
is now polyfilled in all browsers for special (non-printable) keys
attribute is now polyfilled consistently on
object; passed-in props are now never mutated
), events now properly bubble to the parent component
Fixed a case where nesting top-level components would throw an error when updating
Passing an invalid or misspelled propTypes type now throws an error
is now properly normalized in IE9 and IE10
CSS property values no longer have
Fixed a memory leak when unmounting children with a
Fixed an error that could be thrown when removing form elements during a click handler
Components now always remount when the
only when necessary, improving performance in some cases

General performance fixes, memory optimizations, improvements to warnings and error messages
was added as a more general animation wrapper
was added for cloning components and modifying their props
Bug fix for adding back nodes during an exit transition for CSSTransitionGroup
is now supported for two-way binding
Whitespace normalization has changed; now space between two tags on the same line will be preserved, while newlines between two tags will be removed
npm package no longer includes the React core libraries; use the
is now added in more cases, improving error messages and names in the React Dev Tools
Fixed an issue where an invalid token error was thrown after a JSX closing tag
now uses source maps automatically in modern browsers
error messages now include the filename and problematic line contents when a file fails to parse
